refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets moments' values from a matrix.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: btkSetPoint(h, index, values, [residuals, [masks, [residual]]]) btkSetPoint(h, label, values, [residuals, [masks, [residual]]]) points = btkSetPoint(h, index, values, [residuals, [masks, [residual]]]) points = btkSetPoint(h, label, values, [residuals, [masks, [residual]]]) [points, pointsInfo] = btkSetPoint(h, index, values, [residuals, [masks, [residual]]]) [points, pointsInfo] = btkSetPoint(h, label, values, [residuals, [masks, [residual]]])

listitem.para: The handle used to represent an acquisition.
The index of the point (start from 1).
A non empty string representing the label of the selected point.
Point's values corresponding to a matrix (n,3) where n corresponds to the number of frames in the acquisition
Residuals of the 3D reconstruction of markers containing in a matrix (n,1). Note: This parameter is an informational parameter and seems not used in some commercial softwares.

Masks of the camera used to reconstruct markers' positions. mask is a matrix (n,1) of integer corresponding to a conversion of a binary number. For example, the value 14 correspond to the mask 0b0001110 meaning that cameras #2, #3 and #4 was used to reconstruct the point. Note: This parameter is an informational parameter and seems not used in some commercial softwares.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The format of the outputs points and pointsInfo are structures presented in details in the function btkGetPoints.
The acquisition is represented by the handle h. This handle is obtained by the use of a btk* function.
